panel.inputFileSelection.experimentalNot: The feature selected is considered experimental. Parameter files generated may not work as expected.
panel.information.requirementsExplanatio: These are the minimum system requirements for installing the target Linux distribution "{{ distributionName }}" with version "{{ distributionVersion }}".
panel.information.informationExplanation: See the following link for additional information about the selected Linux distribution:
panel.hint.explanation: You need to review the following information to be able to start composing parameter files.
panel.hint.listItem2: OSA device number, layer 2 setting and port number, or
panel.hint.listItem3: PCI device FID or UID, and the partition PCI UID uniqueness setting
panel.hint.listItem8: Host IP address, and netmask or prefix
panel.hint.listItem12: URL of the installation source, such as an FTP server
panel.hint.listItem13: User name and password, if required
panel.networkDevice.deviceTypeHelp: OSA (Open Systems Adapter) or RoCE (PCI RDMA over Converged Ethernet).
panel.networkDevice.vlanIdHelp: Enter a VLAN ID between 1 and 4094.
panel.networkDevice.readChannelHelp: Device bus-ID of the OSA read channel in the format 0.x.y.
panel.networkDevice.writeChannelHelp: Device bus-ID of the OSA write channel in the format 0.x.y.
panel.networkDevice.dataChannelHelp: Device bus-ID of the OSA data channel in the format 0.x.y.
panel.networkDevice.layerTwoToggleHelp: Select 1 for Layer 2 (ethernet) mode, or 0 for Layer 3 (IP) mode.
panel.networkDevice.portNumberToggleHelp: For adapters with multiple ports per CHPID, select port 0 or 1.
panel.networkDevice.fidHelp: Function ID (FID) of the PCI network device in hexadecimal format.
panel.networkDevice.uidHelp: User-defined identifier (UID) of the PCI network device in hexadecimal format.
panel.networkAddress.gatewayAddressHelp: IP address of the gateway server.
panel.networkAddress.nameserverAddressHe: IP address of the DNS nameserver.
panel.networkAddress.networkAddressIPv4H: IPv4 address assigned to the host.
panel.networkAddress.networkAddressIPv6H: IPv6 address assigned to the host.
panel.networkAddress.networkPrefixIPv4He: IPv4 network prefix length between 1 and 32.
panel.networkAddress.networkPrefixIPv6He: IPv6 network prefix length between 1 and 128.
panel.networkAddress.hostnameHelp: Host name, optionally including domain name.
panel.installationParameter.installation: URL of network installation source (HTTP/HTTPS, FTP).
panel.installationParameter.missingRemot: The IP version selected while configuring the network address does not correspond with the value for the hostname as used in the above URL.
panel.installationParameter.computedInst: Installation URL including username and password.
panel.installationParameter.usernameHelp: Username for accessing network installation source.
panel.installationParameter.passwordHelp: Password for accessing network installation source.
panel.installationParameter.vncToggleHel: Activate VNC remote access to graphical installer UI.
panel.installationParameter.vncPasswordH: Specify a password for VNC access.
panel.installationParameter.sshToggleHel: Activate SSH remote access to text-based installer UI.
panel.installationParameter.sshPasswordH: Specify a password for SSH access.
panel.downloadParamFile.incompletOrInval: The data provided is incomplete or invalid. The installation may fail.
panel.downloadParamFile.paramFileHelp: Boot parameters required for the installation.
panel.downloadParamFile.modifiedDataNoti: The data provided has been modified. Changes made will be discarded when returning to a previous dialog step.
You may <1>reset</1> the generated data now to its original state if you intend to make further changes.
panel.nextSteps.explanation1: For installation in LPARs and DPM partitions:
panel.nextSteps.explanation2: After the installer starts, use a VNC client to connect to the system at the following address:
panel.nextSteps.explanation3: After the installer starts, use an SSH client to connect to the system at the following address:
panel.nextSteps.listItem1: Prepare an FTP server with the installer boot files from the RHEL installer ISO:
panel.nextSteps.listItem4: Replace the contents of file <1>genericdvd.prm</1> with the parameter file downloaded from this application.
panel.nextSteps.listItem5: Log on to the IBM Z Hardware Management Console (HMC) that manages the LPAR or DPM partition.
panel.nextSteps.listItem6: Go to the <1>Systems Management</1> view for the associated mainframe and select the LPAR or DPM partition.
panel.nextSteps.listItem8: Select the <1>Recovery</1> task -> <1>Load from Removable Media or Server</1>.
panel.nextSteps.listItem9: Enter the parameters for the FTP server.
panel.nextSteps.listItem14: For LPARs managed in classic mode:
panel.nextSteps.listItem15: Select the <1>Recovery</1> task -> <1>Load from Removable Media or Server</1>
panel.nextSteps.listItem16: Select <1>FTP server</1> and enter server host name, user name, and password
panel.nextSteps.listItem17: From the list of found <1>.ins</1> files select the <1>generic.ins</1> file, then select <1>OK</1>
panel.nextSteps.listItem20: Select <1>Boot from -> FTP server</1> and enter the server host name, user name, and password
panel.nextSteps.listItem21: Specify the path to the <1>generic.ins</1> file or use the <1>Browse</1> button to locate it
panel.nextSteps.listItem23: Specify the path to the directory containing the <1>generic.ins</1> file, then select <1>OK</1>
panel.nextSteps.missingRemoteAccessNotif: Neither VNC nor SSH remote access has been configured. The installation system cannot be manually controlled.
panel.summary.downloadParmfileNameTextHe: A file name for the parameter file to be used if downloaded.
panel.intro.parmFilePurgeNotificationSub: If you proceed to the next step, the existing settings will be purged. You will start anew with an empty parameter file.
